Automatically Set Desktop Background to newest XKCD Comic Strip Using Python

This semester I’m writing my master’s project, which seems to be a time when procrastination thrives. When setting up Ubuntu on my school PC i had to decide what to use for desktop image. I therefore wrote a script to update the desktop background to the most recent XKCD comic strip:

 1 #!/usr/bin/python
 2 # This script gets the latest xkcd comic strip 
 3 # downloads it and makes it the desktop background
 4 # by simen andresen 
 5 
 6 import urllib
 7 from PIL import Image, ImageFont, ImageDraw
 8 from lxml import etree, html
 9 import os
10 import textwrap
11 
12 
13 url='http://www.xkcd.com'
14 
15 # get the comic and save it as png
16 def getImage(imgPath):
17 	page = html.fromstring(urllib.urlopen(url).read())
18 	img=page.xpath('//div[@id="comic"]/img/@src')
19 	img=img[0]
20 	urllib.urlretrieve(img, imgPath+ 'todaysXkcd.png')
21 
22 def getMouseOverText():
23 	page = html.fromstring(urllib.urlopen(url).read())
24 	mText=page.xpath('//div[@id="comic"]/img/@title')[0]
25 	return mText
26 
27 def getHeader():
28 	page = html.fromstring(urllib.urlopen(url).read())
29 	header=page.xpath('//div[@id="ctitle"]/text()')[0]
30 	return header
31 
32 def headerToImage(text,imgPath,fileName):
33 	fontPath = imgPath + "std.ttf"
34 	font = ImageFont.truetype(fontPath, 25)
35 	textW,textH=font.getsize("S")
36 	xkcd=Image.open(imgPath + fileName)	
37 	xwidth, xheight = xkcd.size
38 	img= Image.new("RGBA", (xwidth,588), (255,255,255))
39 	draw=ImageDraw.Draw(img)
40 	margin = offset = 4
41 	for line in textwrap.wrap(text, width=xwidth/textW-1):
42 		draw.text((margin, offset), line, font=font, fill=(0,0,0))
43 		offset += font.getsize(line)[1]
44 	img=img.crop((0,0,xwidth,offset+textH ))
45 	return img
46 
47 def textToImage(imgPath,fileName):
48 	text=getMouseOverText()
49 	fontPath = imgPath + "FreeMono.ttf"
50 	font = ImageFont.truetype(fontPath, 14)
51 	textW,textH=font.getsize("S")
52 	xkcd=Image.open(imgPath + fileName)	
53 	xwidth, xheight = xkcd.size
54 	img= Image.new("RGBA", (xwidth,588), (190,190,190))
55 	draw=ImageDraw.Draw(img)
56 	margin = offset = 5
57 	for line in textwrap.wrap(text, width=xwidth/textW-6):
58 		draw.text((margin, offset), line, font=font, fill=(0,0,0))
59 		offset += font.getsize(line)[1]
60 	img=img.crop((0,0,xwidth,offset+textH ))
61 	return img
62 
63 def stitchImagesTogether(xkcdImgName, imgPath):
64 	sideMargin=20
65 	headerImg=headerToImage(getHeader(),imgPath,xkcdImgName)
66 	textImg=textToImage(imgPath,xkcdImgName)
67 	xImg=Image.open(imgPath + xkcdImgName)
68 	xw,xh=xImg.size
69 	tw,th=textImg.size
70 	hw,hh=headerImg.size
71 	img= Image.new("RGBA", (xw+sideMargin*2,xh+th+hh+2*sideMargin), (255,255,255))
72 	img.paste(headerImg,(sideMargin,sideMargin))
73 	img.paste(xImg,(sideMargin,hh))
74 	img.paste(textImg,(sideMargin,xh+hh+8))
75 	#img.paste(Image.new("RGBA",(xw+sideMargin)))
76 	img.save(imgPath + xkcdImgName)
77 
78 
79 def runAll():
80 	imgPath='/home/simena/household/xkcdDesktop/'
81 	getImage(imgPath)
82 	stitchImagesTogether('todaysXkcd.png',imgPath)
83 	# set the comic as background
84 	osString = 'gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background picture-uri file://'+imgPath +  'todaysXkcd.png' 
85 	os.system(osString)
86 	osString = 'gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background picture-options centered '
87 	os.system(osString)
88 
89 
90 runAll()

The script fetches the image of the comic and the mouseover text. The mouseover text is rendered as an image and finally stitched together with the comic image. If your’re using a Unix based OS you can schedule the script to run e.g. every Monday, Wednesday and Friday using crontab.

The source can be found in my github
